qas.question: What happened to Mary's body at death?
What did Gabriel announce to Mary at the Annunciation?

answers.text: her divine selection to be the mother of Jesus

qas.question: How was Mary related to Jesus?
Which goespel begins its story of Mary with the Annunciation?
Where did Gabriel first meet Jesus?
Who else was present at the Crucifixion of Jesus?
What state was the tomb in when the angel Gabriel found it?

context: The <a4_0>Gospel of Luke<a4_0/> begins its account of Mary's life with the Annunciation, when the angel <a0_0><b7_0>Gabriel<b7_0/><a0_0/> appeared to her and announced <a2_0>her divine selection to be the <a3_0>mother of Jesus<a3_0/><a2_0/>. According to gospel accounts, Mary was present at the Crucifixion of Jesus and is depicted as a member of the early Christian community in <b5_0><b6_0>Jerusalem<b6_0/><b5_0/>. According to Apocryphal writings, at some time soon after her death, her incorrupt body was <a1_0>assumed directly into Heaven<a1_0/>, to be reunited with her soul, and the apostles thereupon found the tomb <b8_0>empty<b8_0/>; this is known in Christian teaching as the Assumption.
